intro: Stemonacanthus salviifolius, commonly known as the salvia-leaved stemonacanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Stemonacanthus salviifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
